intro: Connarus incomptus, commonly known as the narrow-leaved connarus, is a species of flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its slender, often branched stems and small, opposite leaves with a leathery texture. Its flowers are typically white or pale yellow, arranged in clusters, and it produces small, berry-like fruits. Connarus incomptus is often found in moist, shaded environments within tropical forests.
